intro: Baphia dewevrei f. intermedia, commonly known as the African baphia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. The species is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in semi-arid conditions.
